text: I regularly write about Leadership, Technology & Data on Medium — if you would like to read my future posts then please ‘Follow’ me!
translation: 我会定期撰写有关中型领导力，技术和数据的文章-如果您想阅读我以后的文章，请“关注”我！

text: On Making Resolutions
translation: 关于制定决议

text: You don’t need to set a ton of resolutions this year. You simply need a few good ones that will have a positive impact on your programming career and frame of mind. I hope this article has inspired you to start a year that is all about you, in the best possible way!
translation: 您今年无需设定很多决议。 您只需要一些对您的编程职业和心态有积极影响的好人。 希望本文能激发您以最佳的方式开始新的一年！

text: 📌 The Statistics behind New Year’s resolutionsThe statistics on how many people actually follow through and accomplish their New Year’s resolutions are rather grim. Research suggests that approximately half of all Americans make New Year’s resolutions yet only 8% actually achieve them. Also according to 'U.S. News' approximately 80% of resolutions fail by the second week of February!Ouch! Don’t be part of these statistics!📌 Make your career resolutions stickHow can you join this elite few people that pursue their plans and achieve their goals? Here is what the Harvard experts say.
translation: New新年决议背后的统计数据有关实际完成并完成新年决议的人数的统计数据相当严峻。 研究表明，约有一半的美国人制定了新年的决议，但实际上只有8％的人实现了。 同样根据美国 新闻的大约80％的分辨率在2月的第二周失败了！ 不要成为这些统计数据的一部分！📌让您的职业生涯坚持不懈，您如何才能加入这个追求计划并实现目标的精英阶层呢？ 这是哈佛专家所说的。

text: Happy New Year — Happy New Decade
translation: 新年快乐—新年快乐

text: 🤞 Best wishes for a happy, healthy and successful new year. Here’s hoping that 2020 is when all of us get one step closer to the careers we aspire to have and be the people we would like to be.
translation: 🤞祝您新年快乐，健康成功！ 希望在2020年，我们所有人都离我们渴望拥有的职业并成为我们想要成为的人更近一步。

text: 🙏 Last but not least, let me say thanks to all my readers and the TDS Team for this year. It has been a really good one and you all are a great community to be a part of.
translation: 🙏最后但同样重要的是，我要感谢所有读者和本年度的TDS团队。 这是一个非常好的社区，你们都是一个伟大的社区。

text: Thanks for reading!
translation: 谢谢阅读！

text: — 5: Understand the business domain
translation: — 5：了解业务领域

text: In the environment I used to work as a young engineer, a Business Analyst (BA) was the liaison between the Business and the development team, so I was of the belief that if the BA can explain the requirements to me, I will write the code — and that was fine at the early stages of my career. However, I came to the hard realisation that the Business do not care about the code! Our job as Software Engineers is not to produce code, but to add value to the company and make business impact.
translation: 在我以前担任年轻工程师的环境中，业务分析师（BA）是业务与开发团队之间的联络人，因此，我相信，如果BA可以向我解释要求，我会写 代码-在我职业生涯的早期就很好。 但是，我很难理解，业务不关心代码！ 我们作为软件工程师的职责不是生产代码，而是为公司增值并产生业务影响。

text: Taking time to understand how the business operates is a major, but often neglected, part of our job. There is no easy, one-size-fits-all answer as we all probably specialise in different domains, but an idea is to talk to the Business and ask for advice, attend training courses or even seek for a business certification. Your final aim should be to demonstrate that you can contribute a lot of unique and valuable insights in a discussion with the Business! Try for example to point out specifications that are in error and make alternate suggestions that they accept.
translation: 花时间了解业务运作方式是我们工作的主要但经常被忽略的部分。 没有一个简单的，一刀切的所有人都可以回答的问题，因为我们都可能专注于不同领域，但是一个想法是与业务部门交谈并寻求建议，参加培训课程甚至寻求业务认证。 您的最终目标应该是证明您可以在与业务部门的讨论中贡献很多独特而宝贵的见解！ 例如，尝试指出有误的规范并提出其他可接受的建议。

text: In order to solve a problem, you must first understand the problem
translation: 为了解决问题，您必须首先了解问题

text: This will help you tremendously if you would like to progress from a Programmer to Dev Lead, Architect, or Project Manager and gain your seat at the table!
translation: 如果您想从程序员升级为开发负责人，架构师或项目经理，并在工作中获得成功，这将为您提供极大的帮助！

text: — 4: Enhance your people skills
translation: -4：提高您的人际交往能力

text: The idea that developers are introverted geeks that only work alone is totally outdated. Programmers are part of a team and they interact with their peers, their managers and the business users on a daily basis. The number one competence to improve is humility. You might have read my views on this: Programmers with passable technical aptitude but excellent soft skills are outperforming technical gurus in terms of career advancement!!
translation: 开发人员是内向的怪胎，只能独自工作，这种想法已经完全过时了。 程序员是团队的一部分，他们每天与同事，经理和业务用户进行互动。 改进的第一要务是谦卑。 您可能已经阅读了我的以下观点：具有过硬的技术能力但出色的软技能的程序员在职业发展方面胜过技术专家！

text: This is just one aspect of becoming a better developer; for a rounder approach to people skills I prompt you to read these two outstanding books:
translation: 这只是成为更好的开发人员的一个方面。 为了更全面地介绍人际关系，我提示您阅读以下两本出色的书：

texts: Soft Skills: The software developer’s life manual
translations: 软技能：软件开发人员的生活手册

text: — 3: Be a DevOps-minded developer
translation: — 3：成为具有DevOps意识的开发人员

text: Many programmers think that their main responsibility is to code and they consider DevOps as a fluffy concept that doesn’t actually help them improve things on the ground. That is simply not true and embracing DevOps can dramatically help your programming career. My suggestion is to start with these basic DevOps skills:
translation: 许多程序员认为他们的主要职责是编写代码，因此他们将DevOps视作一个松散的概念，实际上并没有帮助他们改善实际情况。 事实并非如此，拥护DevOps可以极大地帮助您的编程事业。 我的建议是从这些基本的DevOps技能入手：

text: Continuous Delivery
translation: 持续交付

text: Continuous Delivery (CD) is the process of building, testing, configuring and deploying software from a build to a production environment. To deliver value to your end users, you must release continually, rapidly, consistently and without errors. Atlassian’s Bamboo is my tool of choice as it is easy to configure and integrates out of the box with Jira. Here you can find more info. For an open-source equivalent try Jenkins.
translation: 持续交付（CD）是从构建到生产环境的构建，测试，配置和部署软件的过程。 为了向最终用户提供价值，您必须持续，快速，一致且无错误地发布产品。 Atlassian的Bamboo是我选择的工具，因为它易于配置并且可以与Jira集成在一起。 在这里您可以找到更多信息。 对于等效的开源软件，请尝试詹金斯。

text: If you still rely on manual processes to deploy your software, do yourself a favour and stop! When you are familiarised with the benefits then using CD will be a no-brainer!
translation: 如果您仍然依靠手动过程来部署软件，请帮个忙，不要停下来！ 当您熟悉了这些好处之后，使用CD就变得轻而易举了！

text: Testing Automation
translation: 测试自动化

text: Software testing is no longer solely the responsibility of the Quality Assurance (QA) specialists associated with the project. When you are continuously delivering software, it cannot be possible to rely on ad hoc and manual tests. I assume you have basic knowledge of TDD (Test Driven Development) so I encourage you to get comfortable with several testing techniques and also BDD (Behaviour Driven Development):
translation: 软件测试不再仅由与项目相关的质量保证（QA）专家负责。 当您持续交付软件时，就不可能依靠临时测试和手动测试。 我假设您具有TDD（测试驱动开发）的基本知识，所以我鼓励您熟悉几种测试技术以及BDD（行为驱动开发）：

translations: 软件测试中的经验教训

text: Application Monitoring
translation: 应用监控

text: Reactive software remedies are not ideal as they disrupt the customer service, so every organisation provides a sort of APM (Application Performance Monitor) system that oversees the CPU usage, disk space, SLAs etc. But as a developer what else can you introduce to aid and complement this effort? Monitoring and analysing logs is important to track application performance, troubleshoot, perform root cause analysis, review system behaviour and predict future disruptions.
translation: 反应性软件补救措施并不理想，因为它们会破坏客户服务，因此每个组织都提供一种APM（应用程序性能监视器）系统，该系统可以监视CPU使用率，磁盘空间，SLA等。但是，作为开发人员，您还能提供什么帮助？ 并补充这项努力？ 监视和分析日志对于跟踪应用程序性能，进行故障排除，执行根本原因分析，检查系统行为并预测将来的中断非常重要。

text: I recommend you focus on the Elastic (ELK) stack, as the company has put together arguably the most popular log management platform for both open source and commercial usage: Elasticsearch for deep search and data analytics, Logstash for centralised logging, log enrichment and parsing and Kibana for powerful and beautiful data visualisations. Their online videos are a nice entry point.
translation: 我建议您专注于Elastic（ELK）堆栈，因为该公司可以说是最受欢迎的开源和商业用途的日志管理平台：Elasticsearch用于深度搜索和数据分析，Logstash用于集中式日志记录，日志扩充和解析 和Kibana提供强大而精美的数据可视化效果。 他们的在线视频是一个不错的切入点。

text: DevOps have exerted significant impact on software development. We just scratched the surface here, but a great resource with DevOps ‘goodness’ to accompany your journey is DZone.
translation: DevOps对软件开发产生了重大影响。 我们只是在这里进行了介绍，但是DZone是DevOps的“善良”伴随您的旅程的一个重要资源。

text: — 2: Focus on the user experience
translation: — 2：关注用户体验

text: Most backend developers think that UX (user experience) design equals UI (user interface) design, so they assume UX is the responsibility of the front end developers. Nope! I will explain the difference by ‘‘paraphrasing’’ a picture I came across in the ‘Hands-On UX Design for Developers’ book. Here is my take on it:
translation: 大多数后端开发人员认为UX（用户体验）设计等于UI（用户界面）设计，因此他们认为UX是前端开发人员的责任。 不！ 我将通过“解释”一幅我在“面向开发人员的动手UX设计”一本书中看到的图片来说明差异。 这是我的看法：

text: UX design is not (only) about visuals; it focuses on the overall feel of the user experience and involves the entire software development lifecycle. How often does the software break, how do you give feedback to the user, how intuitive is the interface, how long does it take to run a batch, how short are the response times, what is the time-to-market to resolve an issue [yes that plays a role here too].
translation: UX设计并非（仅）关于视觉效果。 它着重于用户体验的整体感觉，并涉及整个软件开发生命周期。 软件中断的频率，如何向用户提供反馈，界面的直观性，运行批处理需要多长时间，响应时间短，解决问题的上市时间是多长时间？ 问题[也是在这里也起作用]。

text: I am sharing with you five simple rules on UX that my team and I have learnt the hard way after many years dealing with very hard-to-please bankers and risk managers:
translation: 我正在与您分享关于UX的五个简单规则，我的团队和我在与非常难请的银行家和风险管理者打交了多年之后，学到了艰难的方法：

texts: Involve the users when designing software
Performance is as important as functionality
Error messages should be aimed at the users, not the developers
Clear navigation in a self oriented user interface is the best
Quality assurance is an integral part of software development
translations: 在设计软件时让用户参与
错误消息应针对用户而不是开发人员
在自我导向的用户界面中进行清晰导航是最好的
质量保证是软件开发不可或缺的一部分

text: On UI design in particular these are a couple of resources I recommend you check out: The 101 UX Principles book and also the 99% Invisible podcast.
translation: 特别是关于UI设计，我建议您参考以下两个资源：《 101 UX原理》一书和99％的Invisible podcast。

text: — 1: Learn the art of software crafting
translation: — 1：学习软件制作的技巧

text: It doesn’t take a huge amount of knowledge and skill to get a program working. Everyone can do it. Getting something to work is not a hard thing — getting it right is! Imagine the very first program you wrote when you took your first programming class. And compare it to now. See how far you have come?
translation: 程序运行不需要大量的知识和技能。 每个人都可以做到。 使某事正常工作不是一件难事-做到正确是！ 想象一下您上第一门编程课时编写的第一个程序。 并将其与现在进行比较。 看看你走了多远？

text: Let me now introduce you to the magical world of design patterns, solid principles and software architecture paradigms to see how you can position yourself with the elect few that write elegant software that lasts, has high cohesion and loose coupling and most notably is easy to comprehend, extend and maintain.
translation: 现在，让我向您介绍设计模式，坚实原则和软件体系结构范式的神奇世界，看看您如何才能与少数编写持久，具有高凝聚力和松散耦合的优雅软件的人相处，并且最容易理解 ，扩展和维护。

text: “Architecture is about the important stuff. Whatever that is.” — Ralph Johnson
translation: “建筑是关于重要的东西。 不管是什么。” —拉尔夫·约翰逊（Ralph Johnson）

text: Here are a few all-time classics you should strive to read this year:
translation: 以下是今年您应该努力阅读的一些经典著作：

texts: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
translations: 企业应用程序架构的模式
设计模式：可重用的面向对象软件的元素

text: Software engineering would be better served if you keep your mind on architectural plumbing instead of the latest languages, trendy frameworks, or other development fad. I am not saying that these do not matter; in fact the opposite is true! But if you would like to step up your career, this is my first piece of advice: Focus your energy on structuring and then growing software in such a way that the cost of maintenance is low. In other words: learn about software architecture; your employer will love you!
translation: 如果您将精力放在体系结构方面，而不是使用最新的语言，流行的框架或其他开发风尚，则可以更好地服务于软件工程。 我并不是说这些无关紧要； 事实上，情况正好相反！ 但是，如果您想提高自己的职业生涯，这是我的第一条建议：将精力集中在构建和开发软件上，从而降低维护成本。 换句话说：了解软件体系结构； 你的老板会爱你的！

text: 5 New Year’s Resolutions to Amp Up Your Programming Career
translation: 5项新年计划，以提高您的编程职业

text: How to boost your employability as a Developer in 2020
translation: 如何在2020年提高您作为开发人员的就业能力

text: January 1st is looming, along with the promises that come with the stroke of midnight. So many things to commit to starting or conversely stop. But sometimes our career goals are omitted from our new year resolutions. This is not very prudent since work is such an important part of our lives that should be in our best interest to become better at what we do for living.
translation: 1月1日即将到来，随着午夜的到来而来的诺言也随之而来。 有太多事情要做启动或相反地停止。 但是有时候，我们的新年目标会忽略我们的职业目标。 这不是很审慎，因为工作是我们生活中如此重要的部分，应该使我们最大的利益变得更好，使我们的生活变得更好。

text: We should carefully be considering where we want to be ten years down the line and plan 🅝🅞🅦 how to get there. The end of the decade is a great time to reflect on what has or has not worked for us, and to think about what we can do differently to achieve our goals in the next one.
translation: 我们应该仔细考虑要在未来十年内实现的目标，并计划🅝🅞🅦如何到达那里。 十年末是一个反思对我们有用或不有用的好时机，并思考我们可以采取哪些不同的措施来实现下一个目标。

text: So do take a breather from programming and before you immerse yourself completely in the same old grind, take a few moments to reflect and resolve. With that in mind, here are some resolution ideas and a few accompanied resources to set yourself on a new track.
translation: 因此，一定要从编程中喘一口气，然后再完全沉浸在相同的旧知识中，花一些时间进行反思和解决。 考虑到这一点，这里有一些解决方法的想法和一些相关资源，使您踏上一条新的道路。

text: ⭐️ Pro Tip: As you approach this list, do not be vague. Think to yourself: "What shall I do, by when". You need to make a plan: SMART goals are specific, measurable, achievable, relevant and time bound.
translation: ⭐️专业提示：当您接近此列表时，请不要模糊。 想一想：“到什么时候我该怎么办”。 您需要制定计划：SMART目标是特定的，可衡量的，可实现的，相关的并且有时间限制。

translation: 让我们一起浏览一下清单：
